result.execSummary:
The defendant James D. Leach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant shall receive credit for time served. Sentence shall run consecutive to any other imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution Information attached.  Restitution shall be paid joint and several with Rex Zemialkowski, case 14 CF 308.    Restitution to be paid from all funds received into defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.  Balance to be paid during period of extended supervision  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No intoxicants.  No contact with Trisha Herbert or Rex Zemialkowski.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.
